intro: Oreocharis rhombifolia, commonly known as the rhombic oreocharis, is a flowering plant native to China. It belongs to the family Orchidaceae, commonly known as the orchid family. The plant is characterized by its rhombic-shaped leaves and delicate, often fragrant flowers. It typically grows in shaded, moist environments such as forests and mountainous regions. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
